remarks: The set of variables in a substitution is the union, indexed by the variables in the original expression, of the variables in the substitution to that variable.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jul-2016.)
statement:
msubvrs.s $e |- S = ( mSubst ` T ) $.
msubvrs.e $e |- E = ( mEx ` T ) $.
msubvrs.v $e |- V = ( mVars ` T ) $.
msubvrs.h $e |- H = ( mVH ` T ) $.
msubvrs $p |- ( ( T e. mFS /\ F e. ran S /\ X e. E ) -> ( V ` ( F ` X ) ) = U_ x e. ( V ` X ) ( V ` ( F ` ( H ` x ) ) ) ) $.
$d E x $.
$d F x $.
$d T x $.
$d V x $.
$d X x $.
